ref: 5554 ḌĪ ʻ fly ʼ. [Replacement of √dī1 (RV.) by ḍī -- in Epic from MBh. onwards is attributed by Bloch IA 57 and BSOS v 4 to contamination with dru -- , drā -- ʻ run ʼ. (Cf. uddrāvá -- m. ʻ going upwards ʼ Pāṇ., *uddrāti in Kt. vudra -- ʻ to fly ʼ, &c.). Mayrhofer EWA i 460 prefers influence of cmpd. *niẓ -- ḍī -- (cf. *nīḍāti beside *nirdāti) doubted by J.Wackernagel KZ 67, 161 owing to infrequent occurrence of this cmpd. The forms most frequent and widespread in MIA. and NIA. are from uḍḍī -- , which is perh. for *ūḍī -- (cf. Pa. niḍḍāyati beside *nīḍāti) < *uẓḍī -- < *udz -- dī -- ]
